title.narrative: Maternal and child health, sanitation and protection of the most vulnerable people, victim of the crisis.
Salute materno infantile, igiene e protezione delle persone più vulnerabili vittime della crisi in RDC.

description.narrative: L'intervento intende proteggere le popolazioni più vulnerabili (sfollati, donne, minori e persone con disabilità) e Mmigliorare le condizioni igienico-sanitarie e la salute materno infantile degli sfollati e delle comunità ospitanti, attraverso il rafforzamento dell, di a’accesso all’acqua potabile ed educative dei gruppi più vulnerabili della popolazione nella Provincia del Nord Kivu, attraverso la riduzione del tasso di mortalità e di morbilità materno-infantile, iled il miglioramento potenziamento delle curedei servizi offerti presso le strutture sanitarie gli ospedali di riferimento di Gomalocali e , la riduzione del rischio di malattie idriche, il potenziamento di alcune strutture scolastiche della Provincia, la presa in carico di gruppi di vulnerabili per il loro reinserimento sociale (donne vittime di violenza, e minori persone con disabilità).

The proposed initiatives aims at protecting the most vulnerable population victim of the conflict (IDPs, women, minors and people with disabilities) and at improving water and sanitation condition as well as maternal and child health.In particular, the programme - , formulated in coordination with local authorities and other humanitarian actors operating in the field – will provide , aims at and cost estimations (which have to be considered as budget-based) come from a market survey and availability of operators and products on the local market.Activities will focus on improving access to basic services and local resources, and increasing the visibility of AICS activities in North Kivu to local authorities, international organizations and Italian Entities locally and in Italy.In particular, efforts will be made to and at strengthening public health facilities, in the health and water-sanitation sector. In particular, activities will focus on in the area of prevention of maternal and -infant health and will engage in the, the fight against water diseases. and the strengthening of public healthcare facilities, through the provision of medical equipment, the support for the provincial blood transfusion system, empower extension of the network of the advanced health centerscentres, extend the availability of drinkable water in remote areas, training of staff members and campaigns to rraise public awareness on of the proper health behaviorsbehaviours. Moreover, vulnerable people will be assisted with Projects for support to basic education activities, vocational training and psycho-social support.
